intro: Macleania robusta, commonly known as the robust macleania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. Macleania robusta prefers well-drained, acidic soils and requires consistent moisture to thrive.
